text: Private Schools Athletic Association (PRISAA), founded on February 17, 1953, is an association of private schools, Christian schools, and home school athletic departments throughout the Philippines. The PRISAA exist to bring exposure and credibility to private schools across the nation. The PRISAA accomplishes this with tournaments, national rankings, player/coaching awards and recruiting services. ==History== Palarong Pambansa veteran Lorendale Echavez made waves in her debut in the Private Schools Athletic Association (PRISAA) National Games Sunday by snaring 2 gold medals to highlight hostilities at the Joaquin Enriquez Memorial Sports Complex (JEMSC) in Zamboanga City. The 17-year-old University of San Carlos biology freshman won the women's 200-meter freestyle in 2 minutes and 15.31 seconds, sinking the 3-year-old record of 2:24.69 set also here by Chrizel Lagunday. ==Regular Sports== {| width=99% |valign=top width=25%| *17px Baseball *17px Basketball *17px Boxing |valign=top width=25%| *17px Chess *17px Dancesport *17px Sepak takraw (Boys) |valign=top width=25%| *17px Softball *17px Swimming *17px Table tennis |valign=top width=25%| *17px Taekwondo *17px Tennis *17px Volleyball |} ==2017 PRISAA National Games== It was first announced that the 2017 PRISAA National games will be held at Isabela, Cagayan, but because Cagayan was devastated by Typhoon, the PRISAA National games was forced to move the tournament to Iba, Zambales. ===Sporting Venues=== {| class="wikitable" !colspan=5|Regular Events |- ! width="160" | Event ! width="250" | Venue ! width="250" | Municipality |- | 17px Basketball | Zambales Sports Complex | Iba, Zambales |- | rowspan=2|17px Volleyball | Bancal Barangay Plaza | Botolan, Zambales |- |Palanginan Barangay Plaza |Iba, Zambales |} ===Medal Tally=== {| width=99% |valign=top width=50%| {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center;" | colspan="6" | Senior Division |- ! !
